cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast, cross the Florida Big Bend Thursday, then sweep across Georgia and South Carolina and move offshore into the western Atlantic during Friday-Saturday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch: west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, Georgia coast, and South Carolina coast (including Charleston area)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are possible at Charleston with a peak 23% probability and a small (5%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge (around 2–3 ft) could occur along the South Carolina coast as the storm moves offshore, but official surge guidance for SC has not yet been issued.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 3–6 inches is possible as the center passes nearby Friday, leading to localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and very rough seas/strong coastal currents during Friday.
